topic.title: Too.Much.Internets.
topic.body:
I've been on and off the net since around 1993. Most recently I have been putting my energies into Tor hidden services. Now, I am looking at Zeronet, which is fun to be honest. Love it. All these different technologies to investigate. Then, I accidentally into OpenDNS and the world of alternative TLDs. Oh my.

My mind is blown. Again.

This happened when i first got wind of Linux and switched from Windows 98. Take the top off computing and it's huge! I mean, the internet is turtles all the way down. I knew this already in some sense.  It's just crazy having that realisation a second time. Wander off the well worn clearnet path just a little and the trails and forests of the internets (I know.... "internet") go all over the place. 

I don't want this to sound all "eternal september" with a user being faced with the world outside AOL. but woah dude! The opportunities are incredible. Perhaps I am alone in this silliness? Or not. 

/random-thought

Apologies!

15113_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body:
"a secret section of the online world that is accessible only by using software"

We must ban software!! /s
